DataElement.preferredDefinition: Classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis on the basis of genetic and physical characteristics. There are four racial groups: Australoid, Caucasoid, Mongoloid, and Negroid, or as American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander, White, or Other.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Process of classifying patients into strata Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research._Major living subspecies of man differentiated by genetic and physical characteristics. There are four racial groups: Australoid, Caucasoid, Mongoloid, and Negroid._The process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Property.preferredDefinition: Major living subspecies of man differentiated by genetic and physical characteristics. There are four racial groups: Australoid, Caucasoid, Mongoloid, and Negroid.:The process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

Concepts.definition: A geographic ancestral origin category that is assigned to a population group based mainly on physical characteristics that are thought to be distinct and inherent.
The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC created for CALGB-70807 Reg Worksheet - Race Straqt Factor

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: CLassification of major living subspecies of man into groups (types) differentiated by genetic and physical characteristics: such as, four racial groups: Australoid, Caucasoid, Mongoloid, and Negroid., or alternatively, into 6 groups: American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, White, Other_

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: African American; term used in the United States to categorize a population group comprised of persons having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa, most of whose ancestors were brought from Africa to the Americas as slaves between the sixteenth and nineteenth centuries. Includes population subgroups, e.g. Kenyan, Nigerian, or Haitian. The concept refers also to individuals who classify themselves as described.

Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the Black racial groups of Africa. Terms such as "Haitian" or "Negro" can be used in addition to "Black or African American". (OMB)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent, including for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam. (OMB)

Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent, including for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam. (OMB)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: 10.12.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED WITHDRAWN to RETIRED ARCHIVED in preparation of OneData. Use NCIt based VM instead

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa. (OMB)

Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa. (OMB)

Concepts.definition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
